==Events==
* [[350]] &ndash; The [[Roman usurper]] [[Nepotianus]], of the [[Constantinian dynasty]], proclaims himself [[Roman Emperor]], entering [[Rome]] at the head of a group of [[gladiator]]s.
* [[713]] &ndash; The [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] emperor [[Philippikos Bardanes|Philippicus]] is [[Political mutilation in Byzantine culture|blinded]], deposed and sent into [[exile]] by conspirators of the [[Opsikion]] army in [[Thrace]]. He is succeeded by [[Anastasios II]], who begins the reorganization of the [[Byzantine army]].
*[[1140]] &ndash; The [[France|French]] scholar [[Peter Abelard]] is found guilty of [[Christian heresy|heresy]].
*[[1326]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Novgorod (1326)|Treaty of Novgorod]] delineates borders between [[Russia]] and [[Norway]] in [[Finnmark]].
*[[1539]] &ndash; [[Hernando de Soto]] claims [[Florida]] for [[Spain]].
*[[1608]] &ndash; [[Samuel de Champlain]] completes his third voyage to [[New France]] at [[Tadoussac, Quebec]].
*[[1621]] &ndash; The [[Dutch West India Company]] receives a charter for [[New Netherland]].
*[[1658]] &ndash; [[Pope Alexander VII]] appoints [[François de Laval]] [[Apostolic vicariate|vicar apostolic]] in New France.
*[[1665]] &ndash; [[James II of England|James Stuart]], [[Duke of York]] (later to become King James II of England), defeats the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[Naval fleet|fleet]] off the coast of [[Lowestoft]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[Jack Jouett]] begins his midnight ride to warn [[Thomas Jefferson]] and the Virginia legislature of an impending raid by [[Banastre Tarleton]].
*[[1839]] &ndash; In [[Humen Town|Humen]], [[China]], [[Lin Tse-hsü]] destroys 1.2 million kg of opium confiscated from British merchants, providing Britain with a ''casus belli'' to open hostilities, resulting in the [[First Opium War]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Philippi (West Virginia)|Battle of Philippi]] (also called the Philippi Races) &ndash; [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces rout [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops in [[Barbour County, West Virginia|Barbour County, Virginia]], now [[West Virginia]], in first land battle of the War.
*[[1862]] &ndash; A 3000-strong riot occurred at [[Wardsend Cemetery]] in the [[Sheffield]], [[England]], against rumours of bodysnatching from the grounds.
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Cold Harbor]] &ndash; Union forces attack Confederate troops in [[Hanover County, Virginia]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; The [[Fenian]]s are driven out of [[Fort Erie, Ontario]], into the [[United States]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; In the last military engagement fought on Canadian soil, the [[Cree]] leader, [[Big Bear]], escapes the [[North-West Mounted Police]].
*[[1888]] &ndash; The [[poem]] "[[Casey at the Bat]]", by [[Ernest Lawrence Thayer]], is published in the ''[[San Francisco Examiner]]''.
*[[1889]] &ndash; The transcontinental [[Canadian Pacific Railway]] is completed.
*  1889   &ndash; The first long-distance [[electric power transmission]] line in the United States is completed, running {{convert|14|mi|km}} between a generator at [[Willamette River|Willamette Falls]] and downtown [[Portland, Oregon]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; The [[National Defense Act]] is signed into law, increasing the size of the [[United States National Guard]] by 450,000 men.
*[[1935]] &ndash; One thousand unemployed Canadian workers board freight cars in [[Vancouver, British Columbia]], beginning a protest trek to [[Ottawa, Ontario]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; The [[Edward VIII of the United Kingdom|Duke of Windsor]] marries [[Wallis Simpson]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Luftwaffe]] bombs [[Paris]].
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Dunkirk]] ends with a [[Nazi Germany|German]] victory and with [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces in full retreat.
*  1940   &ndash; [[Franz Rademacher]] proposes [[Madagascar Plan|plans]] to make [[Madagascar]] the "[[Jew]]ish homeland", an idea that had first been considered by 19th century journalist [[Theodor Herzl]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Wehrmacht]] [[Razing of Kandanos|razes]] the [[Greece|Greek]] village of [[Kandanos]] to the ground, killing 180 of its inhabitants.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[Empire of Japan|Japan]] begins the [[Aleutian Islands Campaign]] by [[Battle of Dutch Harbor|bombing]] [[Unalaska Island]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; In [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], white [[U.S. Navy]] sailors and [[United States Marine Corps|Marines]] clash with [[Latino]] youths in the [[Zoot Suit Riots]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; The first successful ascent of an [[Eight-thousander]]; the summit of [[Annapurna]] is reached by [[Maurice Herzog]] and [[Louis Lachenal]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Singapore]] was declared a self-governing state even though it was still a part of the [[British Empire]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; At [[Paris]] [[Orly Airport]], an [[Air France]] [[Boeing 707]] [[Air France Flight 007|overruns the runway and explodes]] when the crew attempts to abort takeoff, killing 130.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The [[Buddhist crisis]]: Soldiers of the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] [[Hue chemical attacks|attack]] protesting [[Buddhist]]s in [[Huế]], [[South Vietnam]], with liquid chemicals from tear-gas grenades, causing 67 people to be hospitalised for blistering of the skin and respiratory ailments.
*[[1965]] &ndash; The launch of ''[[Gemini 4]]'', the first multi-day space mission by a [[NASA]] crew. [[Edward Higgins White|Ed White]], a crew member, performs the first American [[Extra-vehicular activity|spacewalk]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Valerie Solanas]], the author of ''[[SCUM Manifesto]]'', attempts to assassinate [[Andy Warhol]] by shooting him three times.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Melbourne–Evans collision]]: off the coast of [[South Vietnam]], the [[Australia]]n aircraft carrier {{HMAS|Melbourne|R21|6}} cuts the [[U.S. Navy]] destroyer {{USS|Frank E. Evans|DD-754|6}} in half.
*[[1973]] &ndash; A [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[supersonic]] [[Tupolev Tu-144]] [[1973 Paris Air Show crash|crashes]] near [[Goussainville, Val-d'Oise|Goussainville]], France, killing 14, the first crash of a supersonic passenger aircraft.
*[[1979]] &ndash; A blowout at the [[Ixtoc I]] oil well in the southern [[Gulf of Mexico]] causes at least {{convert|3000000|oilbbl|m3}} of oil to be spilled into the waters, the second-worst accidental [[oil spill]] ever recorded.
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[1980 Grand Island tornado outbreak]]. Seven tornadoes hit [[Grand Island, Nebraska]], which take five lives, 357 single-family homes, 33 mobile homes, 85 apartments, 49 businesses and cause $300 million in damages all told, according to statistics compiled on the deadly storm by the National Weather Service and the American Red Cross.
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[Israel]]i [[ambassador]] to the [[United Kingdom]], [[Shlomo Argov]], is shot on a [[London]] street. He survives but is permanently paralysed.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Operation Blue Star]], a military offensive, is launched by the [[India]]n government at [[Harmandir Sahib]], also known as the Golden Temple, the holiest shrine for the [[Sikhs]], in [[Amritsar]]. The operation continues until [[June 6]], with casualties, most of them civilians, in excess of 5,000.
*[[1989]] &ndash; The government of [[China]] sends troops to force protesters out of [[Tiananmen Square]] after seven weeks of occupation.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Mount Unzen]] erupts in [[Kyūshū]], [[Japan]], killing 43 people, all of them either researchers or journalists.
*[[1992]] &ndash; Aboriginal Land Rights are granted in Australia in [[Mabo v Queensland (No 2)]], a case brought by [[Eddie Mabo]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; The union of [[Serbia and Montenegro]] comes to an end with [[Montenegro]]'s formal declaration of independence.
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[United States v. Manning|trial]] of [[United States Army]] private [[Bradley Manning]] (later known as Chelsea Manning) for leaking classified material to [[WikiLeaks]] begins in [[Fort Meade, Maryland]].
